Description: Part of a gold clasp of a necklace or a bracelet, made of a sheet of metal shaped in the form of of a round domed cover ornamented with an embossed rosette of ten petals, and pierced by a small round hole near the centre to thread and knot the string.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, From the denuded surface of the site or the neighbourhood ?
Curator's comments: Among the gold "beads and foil ornaments" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 76 § 73, p. 110, pl. xli, 22.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 76 § 73, pl. xli, 22)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.84, p.186, pl.28)
